00033 
00034 #ifndef DISSIMILARITY_MATRIX_H
00035 #define DISSIMILARITY_MATRIX_H
00036 ///
00037 /// @file dissimilarity.h
00038 /// @brief Data types and functions for dealing with dissimilarity matrices.
00039 ///
00040 
00041 #include <vector>
00042 #include <boost/numeric/ublas/symmetric.hpp>
00043 #include <iostream>
00044 
00045 namespace cluster {
00046   ///
00047   /// Packed repersentation of symmetric dissimilarity matrix.
00048   ///
00049   typedef boost::numeric::ublas::symmetric_matrix<double> dissimilarity_matrix;
00050 
00051   ///
00052   /// Computes a dissimilarity matrix from a vector of objects.
00053   ///
00054   /// @param[in]  objects         Vector of any type T.
00055   /// @param[in]  dissimilarity   A dissimilarity measure that gives the distance between two T's.
00056   ///                             Needs to be callable on (T, T).
00057   /// @param[out] mat             Output parameter.  Dissimiliarity matrix is stored here.
00058   /// 
00059   template <class T, class D>
00060   void build_dissimilarity_matrix(const std::vector<T>& objects, D dissimilarity, 
00061                                   dissimilarity_matrix& mat) {
00062     if (mat.size1() != objects.size() || mat.size2() != objects.size()) {
00063       mat.resize(objects.size(), objects.size());
00064     }
00065     
00066     for (size_t i=0; i < objects.size(); i++) {
00067       for (size_t j=0; j <= i; j++) {
00068         mat(i,j) = dissimilarity(objects[i], objects[j]);
00069       }
00070     }
00071   }
00072 
00073 
00074   ///
00075   /// Computes a dissimilarity matrix from a subset of a vector of objects.
00076   ///
00077   /// @param objects         Vector of any type T.
00078   /// @param subset          Indirection vector.  Contains indices into objects for 
00079   ///                        elements to be compared.
00080   /// @param dissimilarity   A dissimilarity measure that gives the distance between two T's.
00081   ///                        Needs to be callable(T, T).
00082   /// @param mat             Output parameter.  Dissimiliarity matrix is stored here.
00083   template <class T, class D>
00084   void build_dissimilarity_matrix(const std::vector<T>& objects, const std::vector<size_t>& subset,
00085                                   D dissimilarity, dissimilarity_matrix& mat) {
00086     if (mat.size1() != subset.size() || mat.size2() != subset.size()) {
00087       mat.resize(subset.size(), subset.size());
00088     }
00089 
00090     for (size_t i=0; i < subset.size(); i++) {
00091       for (size_t j=0; j <= i; j++) {
00092         mat(i,j) = dissimilarity(objects[subset[i]], objects[subset[j]]);
00093       }
00094     }
00095   }
00096 
00097   
00098   /// Adaptor for passing a matrix by reference to template functions that take
00099   /// a callable distance function.  Avoids copying distance matrix.
00100   struct matrix_distance {
00101     const dissimilarity_matrix& mat;
00102     matrix_distance(const dissimilarity_matrix& m) : mat(m) { }
00103     double operator()(size_t i, size_t j) { return mat(i,j); }
00104   };
00105 
00106 
00107   /// Functor for computing distance lazily from an object array and
00108   /// a distance metric.  Use this for CLARA, where we don't want to
00109   /// precompute the entire distance matrix.
00110   template <class T, class D>
00111   struct lazy_distance_functor {
00112     const std::vector<T>& objects;
00113     D dissimilarity;
00114 
00115     lazy_distance_functor(const std::vector<T>& objs, D d)
00116       : objects(objs), dissimilarity(d) { }
00117 
00118     double operator()(size_t i, size_t j) {
00119       return dissimilarity(objects[i], objects[j]);
00120     }
00121   };
00122 
00123   /// Type-inferred syntactic sugar for constructing lazy_distance_functor.
00124   template <class T, class D>
00125   lazy_distance_functor<T,D> lazy_distance(const std::vector<T>& objs, D dist) {
00126     return lazy_distance_functor<T,D>(objs, dist);
00127   }
00128 
00129 }; // namespace cluster
00130 
00131 #endif // DISSIMILARITY_MATRIX_H
